reviews.text: We had booked into the Spa Resort for our party night on the 11th December. On arrival, the receptionst was very helpful and explained everthing to us with regards to the party night etc. We made our way to our room which was absolutely spotless. Our party was 3 adults, and they had put an extra bed in the room. Even with 3 single beds, the rooms were massive. Loads of space. We had our lunch in the Cruize restaurant, which was really nice and not overly expensive. You had the option to charge food/drink to your room etc, but we chose to pay as we went along. Didnt want a huge bill on check out. The bar staff were very friendly and were always checking to see if we were okay. We all had a treatment, which again was very relaxing and the girl that done mine, was very nice. With regards to the party night, the meal was absolutely beautiful. And the service was great. The only think i didnt like was that because our party was quite small, our table was at the far end of the hall away from everyone else, so we kind of felt quite out of it. And unfortunately, because the other two people in my group were extremely tired from their treatment earlier on, they left as soon as the tables started to get cleared, which meant i had to go along with them. So, no party night for me. Was quite gutted. but on a whole, the auchrannie is a fantastic place to go. I would really love to come one weekend with my husband and two kids and try out the leisure facilites.
reviews.title: The best service I have ever had in a hotel - Will be coming back!

reviews.text: And the only reason i didnt give the hotel 5 stars, was because of the table situation at the party night.
reviews.title: Fantastic food, friendly service, great for kids

reviews.text: We are very frequent visitors to the Spa resort and absolutely love it. We decided to make it our Summer holiday this year and spent 2 weeks there. It was fantastic and you are never short of anything to do in Arran and also inside the hotel if weather bad. The staff this year were as usual very friendly and attentive and the food was first class, especially enjoyed the BBQ evening.

reviews.text: My wife and I, along with my 13 year old son, and a friend of his visited Auchrannie Hotel for a 5 day period. From the outset staff were extremely helpful, finding us a room in the old part of the hotel for the first night and moving us into the Spa Resort for the remaining four nights. This was due to the popularity of the deal they were running where you get an allowance each night to spend in one of their three restaurants. We took full use of this offer, and had some splendid meals in each of the restaurants. The boys also ate in the restaurants and were always made welcome. The food in the 1869 restaurant was excellent, and in the Brambles Restaurant equally as good. The Cruize Restaurant was busy with families, however the standard was still very good with hard working staff keeping things moving along, All in all the facilities, staff and accomodation were exactly as described and cannot be faulted. The evenings were in total luxury, sitting in the relaxing lounges in the old part of the Hotel, prior to your meal, and having a small apertif. We have travelled extensively throughout Europe, on all incusive, and self catering deals and we can say with certainty that Auchrannie is the best Hotel we have stayed in. So much so we are about to book again, to go back at Hogmanay.....
reviews.title: First Hotel which I can only say good things about......
Fantastic first visit and will be back
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at Auchrannie Spa and all of our family enjoyed it. My niece and mum celebrated their birthdays while we were there and they were both given a card and gifts by the staff - what a personal and thoughtful touch. The choice of food for breakfast was phenomenal - you will not leave hungry! We dined at Brambles restaurant for the 3 nights - indicative of how good it was. The food was fresh and tasty - don't leave without trying the steak, mussels or seafood platter - think we all went home with tighter waistbands! It rained quite a lot while we were there but always plenty to do. My wife, mum and sister in law all enjoyed their facials in the spa. Could not fault the staff - all very welcoming and helpful. We will definitely return again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After some rough and tough outdoor adventure, stayed at Auchrannie to feel restored. The room was warm, stylish, modern and comfortable with good quality furnishings and beautiful mountain views. Enjoyed relaxing in the pool and sauna then having a tempting choice of restaurants with imaginative menus. Especially enjoyed the wide range of delicious, healthy food at breakfast. Our short stay was a luxurious treat which certainly left us feeling restored, refreshed and indulged. We'll look forward to doing it again.
reviews.title: A luxurious treat

reviews.text: We stayed at the Auchrannie Spa at the beginning of the October break & had a great time! We made full use of the swimming pool, sauna, games hall, soft play, games room, Cruize restaurant and bar (including cocktails!). The staff were very friendly, helpful and patient (with our 4 children who asked for change for the games machines on a regular basis). The food was excellent, the children were delighted with the kids buffet which enabled them to escape quickly to their games while the adults finished their meal and drinks at their leisure. We can't wait to return - I'd highly recommend the Auchrannie with its high standards yet relaxed atmosphere to all age groups.
reviews.title: Excellent family break, suited everyone!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel specifically because we'd been told it's great for people with kids. On the whole, I'd say this is true. The hotel has an indoor play area as well as a swimming pool with a kids-specific paddling pool that our toddler loved.
reviews.title: Fine but not great

reviews.text: So far so good.
reviews.title: For a girly spa trip, go elsewhere. Would be great for a family trip though.

reviews.text: Where the place let itself down was in overall service. Whilst our room was completely sufficient, the staff were somewhat unenthusiastic and, in some cases, borderline rude. We had dinner one evening in the Brasserie since this is where the play area is (i.e. it's specifically for families) and whilst we weren't expecting Michellin Star quality, my main course arrived without two of the main ingredients in it. When I asked about it, the same plate was returned to me with one out of the two ingredients dumped on top. When I asked about the still missing ingredient, the same plate was returned to me *again* with the second ingredient (the dressing) dumped on top. By this time the rest of my family had finished eating and my dish was inedible anyway. My husband then went up to take his (paid for) dessert from the buffet and was pounced upon immediately when he tried to share a piece of it with my toddler, because we hadn't ordered a 3 course option for him. Pity they weren't so diligent when putting a simple salad together.
reviews.title: Perfect Base To Discover The Magic Of Arran

reviews.text: Auchrannie is a lovely place, ideally located close to the ferry terminal. We stayed in a newly completed Executive Lodge and would find it hard to be disappointed with these, everything from the space, decor and facilities was superb. Ok, a few teething problems with CD player and heating system but these were not a concern. The bedrooms were downstairs and the open plan kitchen and living room upstairs - with a balcony area also for inbetween the rain showers. The island is a nature lovers paradise, in our short 3 days we saw seals, deer and the kids loved the pony trekking over at Blackwaterfoot. Food is a bit pricey but Brambles standard was excellent and the Cruize restaurant was ideal for family dining. The staff were mainly young and from overseas but that did not detract at all from the friendly service we experienced. Many thanks to all and hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Just the tonic !

reviews.text: Just returned from Auchrannie Spa Resort and a fantastic break. The staff were very friendly and happy to help with anything. Ate in 2 of the 3 restaurants and they were both excellent and very child-friendly. Room ideal for 4 yr old as she got a proper bed as opposed to some hotels that have pull down sofa beds. Swimming pool and soft play meant we always had something to do even when the weather was wet.
reviews.title: Really relaxing resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Auchrannie to be everything we had hoped for. The room was huge and very comfortable. The setting was fantastic. Food in the Cruize Bar was excellent and we can't wait to go back. For families there is so much to do, especially with the Outdoor centre just at the back of the hotel. For little ones there was a special room full of foam blocks, for older ones there was a computer games room and in the Spa there was a special pool for the young ones with it's own fountains. All the rooms had big flat screen TV's.
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa is due to be upgraded this winter and this can only be another plus point. It could do with a jacuzzi to supplement the steam rooms and sauna. The only downside for us is ..... it is so far away from where we live. The Isle of Arran is packed with things to do, walking, climbing, playing golf, sitting watching the seals and other wildlife. What could be more delightful than just having to avoid the red deer on the golf course?
reviews.title: great staff and location shame about the price and quality of room

Must compliment the guy who done our room service on the second night he was fantastic belive he works in the brasseire. The first night we ordered room service the wouldnt give me the tray with food and insisted on three people coming into my room to deliver room service.
reviews.title: Very Baby Friendly

description: Auchrannie Spa Resort consists of three separate accommodations - Auchrannie Spa Resort, Auchrannie Country Club and Auchrannie Country House Hotel. With its dignified Scottish Baronial Facade and soft contemporary interiors, the Spa has a unique blend of traditional values of service and quality as well as effortless style. As you would expect from Auchrannie, great care has been taken when designing the contemporary interiors of the Spa Resort's 36 spacious bedrooms to ensure that your every need has been anticipated. All rooms sleep a family of up to two adults and two children comfortably.
